div.p: My greetings beforehand. Faithful, dear godfather, as these laurel berries happened to come into my hands, which were just caught and thus became fresh for me, I have sent them to you; asking you to kindly accept them, etc.

Accordingly, it has come to us how our faithful, dear confederates from Bern have initiated a general search throughout the entire country and have sent the exiled bandits, who are in Geneva and elsewhere, so that they might be better received. I would like to know if it is indeed so; for many among us think it would be a good and Christian work to do this in all evangelical places, and they would be eager to initiate similar searches, as I have now understood from some good-hearted people. Therefore, if you know anything about it, let me know; so I could better motivate the good-hearted.
For the moment, I have nothing further, except what I have noted in the previous letter. Herewith, you are entrusted to the faithful God. My wife and my children send you friendly greetings.
Given at Glarus on the 15th of October, in the year 72. Johannes Hugo of Glarus.
To the venerable master Heinrich Bullinger, pastor at the Grossm√ºnster in Zurich, my faithful, dear lord and godfather.
